com.qtplaf.library.task.sample

Class SampleTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qtplaf.library.task.TaskRunner
      • com.qtplaf.library.task.sample.SampleTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Task, java.lang.Runnable

    public class SampleTask
extends TaskRunner
    Sample task useful to test the different task implementations and to serve as an example of how a task should be written.
    Author:
    Miquel Sas

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean cancelSupported
      Cancel supported.
      private int countSleep
      Maximum sleep when counting, used value will be randomized

      Count steps supported.
      private boolean indeterminate
      Indeterminate, unknown number of steps.
      private boolean pauseSupported
      Pause/resume supported.
      private int stepsBase
      Steps base.
      private int stepSleepMillis
      Maximum step sleep in millis, used value will be randomized.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private long calculateSteps()
      Calculates the number of steps by multiplying the multpliyer by random.netxInt(100)
      long countSteps()
      If the task supports pre-counting steps, a call to this method forces counting (and storing) the number of steps.
      void execute()
      Executes the underlying task processing.
      boolean isCancelSupported()
      Returns a boolean indicating whether the task will support cancel requests.
      boolean isCountStepsSupported()
      Returns a boolean indicating if the task supports counting steps through a call to countSteps().
      boolean isIndeterminate()
      Returns a boolean indicating if the task is indeterminate, that is, the task can not count its number of steps.
      boolean isPauseSupported()
      Returns a boolean indicating whether the task will support the pause/resume requests.
      void setCancelSupported(boolean cancelSupported) 
      void setCountSleep(int countSleep) 
      void setCountStepsSupported(boolean countStepsSupported) 
      void setExtent(int extent)
      Set the extent of the task in milliseconds, without including the count sleep that, by default is 100 millis.

      void setPauseSupported(boolean pauseSupported) 
      void setStepsBase(int stepsBase) 
      void setStepSleep(int stepSleepMillis)
      Set the step sleep in millis.
      void setupDeterminateCountStepsNotSupported(boolean cancelSupported, boolean pauseSupported)
      Setup as a determinate task that does not support countSteps: notifies either the number of steps and the steps themselves.
      void setupDeterminateCountStepsSupported(boolean cancelSupported, boolean pauseSupported)
      Setup as a determinate task that does support countSteps: notifies either the number of steps and the steps themselves.
      void setupIndeterminate(boolean cancelSupported, boolean pauseSupported)
      Setup as an indeterminate task: does not notify either the number of steps or the steps themselves.

      Useful sleep without having to deal with the exception.

      Sleep a step.

        Pause/resume supported.

      • stepsBase

        private int stepsBase
        Steps base. Steps are calculated randomizing this base, zero is not accepted.

        Maximum sleep when counting, used value will be randomized

        Maximum step sleep in millis, used value will be randomized.

      • setExtent

        public void setExtent(int extent)
        Set the extent of the task in milliseconds, without including the count sleep that, by default is 100 millis.

      • setupIndeterminate

        public void setupIndeterminate(boolean cancelSupported,
                               boolean pauseSupported)
        Setup as an indeterminate task: does not notify either the number of steps or the steps themselves. Used default values.
        Parameters:
        cancelSupported - Cancel supported.
        pauseSupported - Pause/resume supported.

      • setupDeterminateCountStepsNotSupported

        public void setupDeterminateCountStepsNotSupported(boolean cancelSupported,
                                                   boolean pauseSupported)
        Setup as a determinate task that does not support countSteps: notifies either the number of steps and the steps themselves. Uses default values.
        Parameters:
        cancelSupported - Cancel supported.
        pauseSupported - Pause/resume supported.

      • setupDeterminateCountStepsSupported

        public void setupDeterminateCountStepsSupported(boolean cancelSupported,
                                                boolean pauseSupported)
        Setup as a determinate task that does support countSteps: notifies either the number of steps and the steps themselves. Uses default values.
        Parameters:
        cancelSupported - Cancel supported.
        pauseSupported - Pause/resume supported.

      • sleepCount

        private void sleepCount()
        Sleep prior to count.

      • sleepStep

        private void sleepStep()
        Sleep a step. Nanos are not randomized.

      • calculateSteps

        private long calculateSteps()
        Calculates the number of steps by multiplying the multpliyer by random.netxInt(100)
        Returns:
        The number of steps to use.

      • countSteps

        public long countSteps()
        If the task supports pre-counting steps, a call to this method forces counting (and storing) the number of steps.
        Returns:
        The number of steps.

      • execute

        public void execute()
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Executes the underlying task processing.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If an unrecoverable error occurs during execution.

      • isCancelSupported

        public boolean isCancelSupported()
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the task will support cancel requests.
        Returns:
        A boolean.

      • isCountStepsSupported

        public boolean isCountStepsSupported()
        Returns a boolean indicating if the task supports counting steps through a call to countSteps().
        Returns:
        A boolean.

      • isIndeterminate

        public boolean isIndeterminate()
        Returns a boolean indicating if the task is indeterminate, that is, the task can not count its number of steps.
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating if the task is indeterminate.
